title.rendered: Did the singer José Luis Rodríguez “El Puma” die?  It’s false

content.rendered:
It’s false. Rumors about the death of Venezuelan singer José Luis Rodríguez, also known as “El Puma”, spread on social networks after a video posted on YouTube reported on his alleged death.

However, the news is false. The producer of the artist’s events in Chile, Claudio Castro, denied the information. One day after the publication of the fake news, the manager announced that the artist will perform in September at the Movistar Arena in that country.

diffusion of the fake news

The audiovisual with false information has more than 22,500 views. It was published on February 21, 2022 by the Viral Noticias channel, which in the last 10 days has spread disinformation through videos.

The link was shared on the WhatsApp messaging platform, where users shared the false news.

A day later, the YouTube channel published the false information that the Argentine singer Ricardo Montaner had allegedly died. Other misinformation spread in the account mentions artists such as Leo Dan, Mario Cimarro and Roberto Carlos.

Health status of “El Puma”

The singer, who is currently active on social networks, underwent a double lung transplant in 2017, after struggling for several years with pulmonary fibrosis.

After the postoperative process and after several years of recovery, “El Puma” returned to the stage. For 2022, several special presentations are scheduled in the United States and Chile.
